medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute onset of sharp, nonradiating epigastric pain yesterday morning, associated with nausea and vomiting. He reported spitting up approximately one tablespoon of blood. Initially, there was more significant abdominal pain, but it has since diminished. He denies fevers, chills, chest pain, dysuria, and back pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma s/p chemotherapy, radiation and tracheostomy (now with tracheostomy removed), G-tube dependence, alcohol abuse, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, nicotine addiction, depression, insomnia, benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)
